wifireg.defcon.org/android.html

In order to access the DEF CON 30 Wireless Network, you must have already registered.
If you have not done so, please register at https://wifireg.defcon.org and take care of that first.

Once you have registered, download the DEF CON Wifi Certificate and install locally.

You can obtain the certificate https://wifireg.defcon.org/certfigs/defcon30-wifi.crt.

Note: Android comes in many versions, variants, flavors, shapes, sizes and smells. Please treat the following instructions as an approximate guide to this setup. Your experience may differ.

On your Android device, open Settings:

-> Security
-> Certificate Management
-> Install from storage
-> Navigate to and select defcon30-wifi.crt
-> Enter "DEF CON Wifi Cert" for the certificate name
-> Select "Wi-Fi" for Credential Use
-> Answer Yes or OK if prompted to accept the certificate

Next, connect and verify DEF CON network and intermediary certificate.

On your Android device, open Settings:
-> Wi-Fi
-> Select the DefCon network
-> EAP method = PEAP
-> Phase 2 Authentication = MSCHAPv2
-> CA certificate = "Use system certificates"
-> Domain = wifireg.defcon.org
-> Identity = YOUR_USERNAME
-> Anonymous Identity, leave this blank
-> Password = YOUR_PASSWORD
-> Select Connect

And now your are done!
